Description: Rim fragment of East Greek pottery cup. On exterior of rim, laurel; handle zone reserved between black bands. Interior glazed with reserved band 0.1 cm below the lip. Inscription deeply incised on the exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 52 no. 178 pl. 41)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 258)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.870)
